package-manager.name: depot
package-manager.title: Pidgin IM client
package-manager.description: Pidgin allows you to talk to anyone using a variety of messaging protocols including AIM, MSN, Yahoo!, XMPP, Bonjour, Gadu-Gadu, ICQ, IRC, Novell Groupwise, QQ, Lotus Sametime, SILC, Simple and Zephyr. These protocols are implemented using a modular, easy to use design. To use a protocol, just add an account using the account editor.

item.para: Upgrade gnutls dependency from 2.4.2 to 2.10.5
Upgrade gtk+ dependency from 2.12.11 to 2.22.1
Upgrade gtkspell dependency from 2.0.11 to 2.0.16

Apply patch for CVE-2009-2703 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2703). libpurple/protocols/irc/msgs.c in the IRC protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote IRC servers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a TOPIC message that lacks a topic string.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3026 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3026). protocols/jabber/auth.c in libpurple in Pidgin does not follow the "require TLS/SSL" preference when connecting to older Jabber servers that do not follow the XMPP specification, which causes libpurple to connect to the server without the expected encryption and allows remote attackers to sniff sessions.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3083 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3083). The msn_slp_sip_recv function in libpurple/protocols/msn/slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an SLP invite message that lacks certain required fields, as demonstrated by a malformed message from a KMess client.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3085 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3085). The XMPP protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin does not properly handle an error IQ stanza during an attempted fetch of a custom smiley, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via XHTML-IM content with cid: images.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3615 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3615). The OSCAR protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted contact-list data for (1) ICQ and possibly (2) AIM, as demonstrated by the SIM IM client.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0013 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0013). Directory traversal vulnerability in slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in an application/x-msnmsgrp2p MSN emoticon (aka custom smiley) request, a related issue to CVE-2004-0122. NOTE: it could be argued that this is resultant from a vulnerability in which an emoticon download request is processed even without a preceding text/x-mms-emoticon message that announced availability of the emoticon.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0277 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0277). slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed MSNSLP INVITE request in an SLP message, a different issue than CVE-2010-0013.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0420 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0420). libpurple, when an XMPP multi-user chat (MUC) room is used, does not properly parse nicknames containing
sequences, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted nickname.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0423 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0423). gtkimhtml.c in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption and application hang) by sending many smileys in a (1) IM or (2) chat.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-1624 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1624). The msn_emoticon_msg function in slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a custom emoticon in a malformed SLP message.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3711 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3711). libpurple in Pidgin does not properly validate the return value of the purple_base64_decode function, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted message, related to the plugins for MSN, MySpaceIM, XMPP, and Yahoo! and the NTLM authentication support.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-3184 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-3184). The msn_httpconn_parse_data function in httpconn.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple does not properly handle HTTP 100 responses, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (incorrect memory access and application crash) via vectors involving a crafted server message.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-3594 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-3594). The g_markup_escape_text function in the SILC protocol plug-in in libpurple allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via invalid UTF-8 sequences that trigger use of invalid pointers and an out-of-bounds read, related to interactions with certain versions of glib2.

package-manager.description: Pidgin allows you to talk to anyone using a variety of messaging protocols including AIM, MSN, Yahoo!, XMPP, Bonjour, Gadu-Gadu, ICQ, IRC, Novell Groupwise, QQ, Lotus Sametime, SILC, Simple and Zephyr. These protocols are implemented using a modular, easy to use design. To use a protocol, just add an account using the account editor.

item.para: Upgrade gnutls dependency from 2.4.2 to 2.10.5.
Upgrade gtk+ dependency from 2.12.11 to 2.22.1.
Upgrade gtkspell dependency from 2.0.11 to 2.0.16.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-2703 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-2703). libpurple/protocols/irc/msgs.c in the IRC protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote IRC servers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a TOPIC message that lacks a topic string.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3026 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3026). protocols/jabber/auth.c in libpurple in Pidgin does not follow the "require TLS/SSL" preference when connecting to older Jabber servers that do not follow the XMPP specification, which causes libpurple to connect to the server without the expected encryption and allows remote attackers to sniff sessions.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3083 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3083). The msn_slp_sip_recv function in libpurple/protocols/msn/slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an SLP invite message that lacks certain required fields, as demonstrated by a malformed message from a KMess client.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3085 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3085). The XMPP protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin does not properly handle an error IQ stanza during an attempted fetch of a custom smiley, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via XHTML-IM content with cid: images.

Apply patch for CVE-2009-3615 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2009-3615). The OSCAR protocol plugin in libpurple in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via crafted contact-list data for (1) ICQ and possibly (2) AIM, as demonstrated by the SIM IM client.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0013 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0013). Directory traversal vulnerability in slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote attackers to read arbitrary files via a .. (dot dot) in an application/x-msnmsgrp2p MSN emoticon (aka custom smiley) request, a related issue to CVE-2004-0122. NOTE: it could be argued that this is resultant from a vulnerability in which an emoticon download request is processed even without a preceding text/x-mms-emoticon message that announced availability of the emoticon.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0277 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0277). slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed MSNSLP INVITE request in an SLP message, a different issue than CVE-2010-0013.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0420 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0420). libpurple, when an XMPP multi-user chat (MUC) room is used, does not properly parse nicknames containing
sequences, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted nickname.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-0423 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-0423). gtkimhtml.c in Pidgin allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption and application hang) by sending many smileys in a (1) IM or (2) chat.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-1624 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-1624). The msn_emoticon_msg function in slp.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a custom emoticon in a malformed SLP message.

Apply patch for CVE-2010-3711 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2010-3711). libpurple in Pidgin does not properly validate the return value of the purple_base64_decode function, which allows remote authenticated users to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via a crafted message, related to the plugins for MSN, MySpaceIM, XMPP, and Yahoo! and the NTLM authentication support.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-3184 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-3184). The msn_httpconn_parse_data function in httpconn.c in the MSN protocol plugin in libpurple does not properly handle HTTP 100 responses, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (incorrect memory access and application crash) via vectors involving a crafted server message.

Apply patch for CVE-2011-3594 (http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2011-3594). The g_markup_escape_text function in the SILC protocol plug-in in libpurple allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via invalid UTF-8 sequences that trigger use of invalid pointers and an out-of-bounds read, related to interactions with certain versions of glib2.
